title: Newtons second law - acceleration of rocket

content.question: A spacecraft in deep space fires its thruster, which ejects fuel from the spacecraft. The ejected fuel exerts a constant force on the spacecraft and the total mass of the spacecraft decreases at a constant rate. Which of the following graphs best represents the acceleration of the spacecraft as a function of time while the thruster is firing?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Acceleration.” The curve begins at the origin and moves steeply upward and to the right, almost vertically, until it reaches a point high above the horizontal axis and just to the right of the vertical axis. From here, it begins to move very gradually upward and to the right until ends high above the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Acceleration.” The curve begins on the vertical axis, above the origin, and moves gradually upward and to the right, until it reaches a point approximately two thirds of the way along the horizontal axis and halfway up the vertical axis. From here, it begins to move steeply upward and to the right until ends high above the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Acceleration.” The line begins on the vertical axis, approximately two thirds of the way up the axis, and moves horizontally to the right. It ends far to the right of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Acceleration.” The line begins on the vertical axis, approximately two thirds of the way up the axis, and slants downward and to the right. It ends far to the right of the horizontal axis and just above the vertical axis.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Acceleration.” The curve begins on the vertical axis, above the origin, and moves gradually upward and to the right, until it reaches a point approximately two thirds of the way along the horizontal axis and halfway up the vertical axis. From here, it begins to move steeply upward and to the right until ends high above the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.
